Name: Flexible Focus
Requirements:
Proficiency with an implement. 
A weapon attack power.
An implement attack power.
An Offense Focus feat with the Weapon keyword.
Text: Choose an Offense Focus Feat with the Implement keyword. You gain that feat. (Ignore the usual restrictions about only having a single Feat of that category).
Summary: Gain extra Implement Focus feat if you have Weapon Focus.

Name: Skill Training
Text: Choose a skill in which you are untrained. You gain training in that skill.

Name: Unnatural Ability
Text: Choose two skills in which you are trained and have an Ability Modifier lower than 3. Your Ability Modifier for these skills becomes 3.
Summary: Ability Modifier for two Trained Skills becomes +3.

Name: Heroic Skill Focus
Text: Choose a Trained Skill in your Class Skill list or your Racial Skill list. You gain Focus with that Skill (+3 on checks, automatically succeed Easy checks, allow Very Hard checks.)
Summary: Gain Focus in a Trained Skill from your class or race.

Name: Ritual Training
Text:
Choose a Heroic Ritual. You learn that ritual.
You can learn 2 additional Heroic Rituals through ritual scrolls.
Summary: Learn 1 Heroic Ritual, can learn 2 more from scrolls.

Name: Linguist
Text: Choose a language you don't know. You learn that language.

Name: Paragon Skill Focus
Text: Choose a Trained Skill in your Class Skill list or your Racial Skill list. You gain Focus with that Skill (+3 on checks, automatically succeed Easy checks, allow Very Hard checks.)
Summary: Gain Focus in a Trained Skill from your class or race.

Name: Paragon Ritual Training
Text:
Choose a Paragon Ritual. You learn that ritual.
You can learn 2 additional Paragon Rituals through ritual scrolls.
Summary: Learn 1 Paragon Ritual, can learn 2 more from scrolls.

Name: Epic Skill Focus
Text:
Choose any Trained Skill. You gain Focus with that Skill (+3 on checks, automatically succeed Easy checks, allow Very Hard checks.)
Note: If you take multiple instances of this feat, you must choose different skills each time.
Summary: Gain Focus in any Trained Skill.

Name: Epic Ritual Training
Text:
Choose an Epic Ritual. You learn that ritual.
You can learn 2 additional Epic Rituals through ritual scrolls.
Summary: Learn 1 Epic Ritual, can learn 2 more from scrolls.

Name: Multiclass Learning: At-Will
Text:
Choose a Level 1 At-Will Attack Power from your Multiclass. You can use that power once per encounter.
If the Primary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 4 instead.
If the Secondary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 2 instead.

Name: Multiclass Learning: Encounter
Text:
Choose an Encounter Attack Power from your Class. You lose that power, and gain an Encounter Attack Power of the same level or lower from your Multiclass.
If the Primary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 4 instead.
If the Secondary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 2 instead.
Summary: Trade Class Encounter attack for Multiclass Encounter attack

Name: Multiclass Learning: Daily
Text:
Choose a Daily Attack Power from your Class. You lose that power, and gain a Daily Attack Power of the same level or lower from your Multiclass.
If the Primary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 4 instead.
If the Secondary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 2 instead.
Summary: Trade Class Daily attack for Multiclass Daily attack

Name: Multiclass Learning: Utility
Text: Choose a Utility Power from your Class. You lose that power, and gain a Utility Power of the same level or lower from your Multiclass.
Summary: Trade Class Utility power for Multiclass Utility power

Name: Multiclass Learning: Augmentable
Requirements:
A Multiclass Feat. 
Class with Augmentable At-Will attacks.
Multiclass to a class with Augmentable At-Will attacks.
Text:
Choose an Augmentable At-Will Attack Power from your Class. You lose that power, and gain an Augmentable At-Will Attack Power of the same level or lower from your Multiclass.
If the Primary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 4 instead.
If the Secondary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 2 instead.
Summary: Trade Class Augmentable At-Will attack for Multiclass Augmentable At-Will attack

Name: Multiclass Learning: Encounter to Augmentable
Requirements:
A Multiclass Feat. 
Class without Augmentable At-Will attacks.
Multiclass to a class with Augmentable At-Will attacks.
Text:
Choose an Encounter Attack Power from your Class. You lose that power, and gain an Augmentable At-Will Attack Power of the same level or lower from your Multiclass.
If the Primary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 4 instead.
If the Secondary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 2 instead.
You gain 2 Power Points per Tier of the power.
Summary: Trade Class Encounter attack for Multiclass Augmentable At-Will attack. Gain 2 Power Points per power tier.

Name: Multiclass Learning: Augmentable to Encounter
Requirements:
A Multiclass Feat. 
Class with Augmentable At-Will attacks.
Multiclass to a class without Augmentable At-Will attacks.
Text:
Choose an Augmentable At-Will Attack Power from your Class. You lose that power, and gain an Encounter Attack Power of the same level or lower from your Multiclass.
If the Primary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 4 instead.
If the Secondary Ability for that power does not match yours, use an ability value of 2 instead.
You lose 2 Power Points per Tier of the power.
Summary: Trade Class Augmentable At-Will attack for Multiclass Encounter attack. Lose 2 Power Points per power tier.

Name: Multiclass Implement
Requirements:
A Multiclass Feat.
Multiclass to a class with Implement attacks.
Text:
Choose an Implement that your Multiclass has Training with. Gain Training with that Implement.
Choose a skill from your Multiclass class skill list in which you are untrained. You gain training in that skill.
Summary: Gain Training in Multiclass Implement. Gain Training in Multiclass Skill.
